subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: study of how to make money
b: study of how people make choices to satisfy their wants
c: study of how to manage resources
d: study of how to produce goods

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: state of abundant resources
b: state of equilibrium
c: state of insufficient resources to meet unlimited wants
d: state of economic growth

author: John Doe
a: cost of producing a good

author: John Doe
a: amount of goods and services buyers are willing to buy and pay for

author: John Doe
a: amount of goods and services buyers are willing to buy and pay for

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: state where the quantity of a good demanded is greater than the quantity supplied
b: state where the quantity of a good demanded is less than the quantity supplied
c: state where the quantity of a good demanded equals the quantity supplied
d: state where the price of a good is constant

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is Price Elasticity of Demand ?
a: measure of how responsive the quantity supplied of a good is to a change in its price
b: measure of how responsive the demand for a good is to a change in the price of another good
c: measure of how responsive the supply of a good is to a change in the price of another good
d: measure of how responsive the quantity demanded of a good is to a change in its price

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: difference between the actual price paid for a good and the minimum price a consumer is willing to pay
b: total benefit derived by a consumer from consuming a good
c: total cost incurred by a consumer in purchasing a good
d: difference between the maximum price a consumer is willing to pay for a good and the actual price paid

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: difference between the minimum price a producer is willing to accept for a good and the actual price received
b: total revenue earned by a producer from selling a good
c: total cost incurred by a producer in producing a good
d: difference between the actual price received by a producer for a good and the minimum price the producer is willing to accept

author: John Doe

b: sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy over a period of time

author: John Doe

b: exchange of goods and services within a country

author: John Doe

author: John Doe

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
a: process of combining different economies into a single economy
b: process of separating different economies into individual economies
c: process of managing different economies as separate entities
d: process of ignoring different economies

author: John Doe

author: John Doe

b: policy of promoting free trade between countries

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the main goal of macroeconomic policy?
a: to reduce unemployment
b: to increase economic growth
c: to control inflation
d: all of the above

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of diminishing marginal utility?
a: the more you consume, the more satisfaction you get
b: the more you consume, the less satisfaction you get
c: the more you consume, the same satisfaction you get
d: the more you consume, the satisfaction remains constant

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the difference between a need and a want?
a: a need is something you can live without, while a want is something you cannot live without
b: a need is something you cannot live without, while a want is something you can live without
c: a need is something you can buy, while a want is something you cannot buy
d: a need is something you cannot buy, while a want is something you can buy

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of opportunity cost?
a: the cost of choosing one option over another
b: the cost of producing a good
c: the cost of consuming a good
d: the cost of investing in a business

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the law of supply?
a: as the price of a good increases, the quantity supplied decreases
b: as the price of a good increases, the quantity supplied increases
c: as the price of a good decreases, the quantity supplied increases
d: as the price of a good decreases, the quantity supplied decreases

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of consumer surplus?
a: the difference between the maximum price a consumer is willing to pay and the actual price paid
b: the difference between the actual price paid and the minimum price a consumer is willing to pay
c: the total benefit derived by a consumer from consuming a good
d: the total cost incurred by a consumer in purchasing a good

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of producer surplus?
a: the difference between the actual price received by a producer and the minimum price the producer is willing to accept
b: the difference between the minimum price a producer is willing to accept and the actual price received
c: the total revenue earned by a producer from selling a good
d: the total cost incurred by a producer in producing a good

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of economic efficiency?
a: the production of goods and services at the lowest possible cost
b: the production of goods and services at the highest possible cost
c: the production of goods and services that maximizes consumer satisfaction
d: the production of goods and services that minimizes consumer satisfaction

subject: Economics
author: John Doe
ask: What is the concept of economic growth?
a: an increase in the production of goods and services in an economy over time
b: a decrease in the production of goods and services in an economy over time
c: a change in the production of goods and services in an economy over time
d: no change in the production of goods and services in an economy over time

author: John Doe
ask: What is the main goal of macroeconomic policy?
a: to reduce unemployment
b: to increase economic growth
c: to control inflation
d: all of the above

a: the more you consume, the more satisfaction you get
